Source code for vagabond

import tkinter as tk


WIDTH = 1280
HEIGHT = 720

"""
Web Browser class.
"""


[docs]
class Vagabond:

    def __init__(self):
        self.window = tk.Tk()
        self.canvas = tk.Canvas(self.window, width=WIDTH, height=HEIGHT)
        # self.canvas.pack()
        self.input_text = ""



[docs]
    def run(self):
       # Create and configure widgets
        self.label = tk.Label(self.window, text="Enter Text:")
        self.entry = tk.Entry(self.window, textvariable=self.input_text)  # Link the Entry to the input_text variable
        self.button = tk.Button(self.window, text="Save Text", command=self.save_text)

        # Organize widgets using grid layout manager
        self.label.grid(row=0, column=0)
        self.entry.grid(row=0, column=1)
        self.button.grid(row=1, columnspan=2)



    # Function to handle the button click event


[docs]
    def save_text(self):
        input_text = self.entry.get()  # Get the text from the Entry widget
        self.label.config(text=f"Saved Text: {input_text}")
        self.entry.delete(0, "end")





"""
Main
"""
if __name__ == "__main__":
    # input_url = input("Please input the URL you would like to visit: ")
    # print()
    Vagabond().run()
    tk.mainloop()
